result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Marquette County Treatment Court Diversion Contract

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees with the waiver.  Court accepts the waiver of the Prelim.

  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings.

Atty Juech files the information electronically with the Court.  Atty Frank received a copy of the information and waives its reading.

1:23 PM Defendant Jessica Jean Skiff in court.  Attorney Brian J. Juech appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Ryan T. Frank appeared by video for Jessica Jean Skiff. 
Atty Frank is prepared to proceed today and states plea agreement to Count 1 which includes entry in the Marquette County Treatment Court Program.  Count 2 to be dismissed and read-in.
Atty Juech agrees.  Defendant agrees.

Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Atty Frank states that the defendant has to waive the Prelim.  Court goes over waiver of Prelim.

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.  
Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea on Count 1; approves and signs the Marquette County Treatment Court Program contract. 
Count 2 to be dismissed and read-in.
Credit = 2 days (if revoked)
Treatment Court Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Treatment Court Hearing on May 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: for Leave to File Additional Motions
Status hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:14 AM Defendant Jessica Jean Skiff appeared by video means with Attorney Ryan T. Frank. Prosecuting Atty Brian J. Juech appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Frank received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of the maximum penalties.  BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Atty Frank states defendant will waive time limits.  Defendant agrees.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds waiver of time limits made freely.  Status hearing scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription

03:15 PM Defendant Jessica Jean Skiff appeared by video means from Marquette County Jail. Prosecuting Atty Clifford C. Burdon appeared for State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.    Court confirms address and phone.    Court finds probable cause for the charges for Riverside purposes.
  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands and did qualify for Public Defender.  

Atty Burdon requests a $500 Signature bond with conditions.

BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*No use or possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription  Initial appearance scheduled for March 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
